description: This course examines how nature is imagined, described, and consumed in Japanese literature and
culture, and considers moments when the natural environment becomes inhospitable to human life.
Students explore the relationships between humans and nature in Japanese literature and popular
culture by: (1) tracing traditions from eigth-century landscape poetry to post-apocalyptic
narratives in contemporary anime, (2) reading Japanese literature from a perspective of
ecological criticism, and (3) producing their own works of nature writing.  Counts toward Asian
studies major and Asian studies and Japan studies concentrations.  Prerequisite: FYW.
fullname: Nature in Japanese Literature and Culture
